string.text: Standard 9x18 APS Magazine
Standard 9x18 APS Magazine with a capacity of 20 rounds. The APS saw limited use as a personal defense weapon, supplanted by the AKS-74U and later the OTs-33.
Modified 9x19 APS Magazine
APS Magazine modified by an enterprising technician to hold 9x19 Parabellum cartridges.
Standard 9x19 Beretta 92F Magazine
Standard-issue Beretta 92F Magazine that holds 15 rounds. The Beretta remains a perennial favorite of gangsters and Hong Kong action movie stars.
Modified 9x18 Beretta 92F Magazine
Beretta Magazine modified to fit the more common 9x18 Makarov cartridge.
Standard .45 ACP Colt 1911 Magazine
Standard Colt 1911 Magazine holding 7 rounds. While the 1911's rather low capacity makes it obsolete compared to other more modern .45 handguns, it is cheaper and much easier to acquire.
Standard .45 ACP Colt Kimber Magazine
Standard Colt Kimber Magazine holding 7 rounds. Higher quality than the standard issue 1911 magazine, it nonetheless suffers from the same anemic ammo capacity.
Standard 7.62x25 CZ-52 Magazine
Standard 8-round CZ-52 magazine. The historic Russian round has its admirers still.
Standard 9x19 CZ-75 Magazine
Standard CZ-75 Magazine with a capacity of 16 rounds.
Modified 9x18 CZ-75 Magazine
Aftermarket CZ-75 magazine modified to feed 9x18 rounds. A common sight in the Zone, given the ubiquity of 9x18 Makarov rounds.
Standard .357 Desert Eagle Magazine
Standard .357 Desert Eagle Magazine holding 7 rounds. Even the magazine is massive.
Standard 5.7x28 Five-seveN Magazine
Standard-issue Five-seveN magazine holding 20 rounds. Extremely well built magazine for a very effective sidearm, however the ammunition is quite scarce.
Standard .45 ACP FNP-45 Magazine
Standard-issue FNP-45 Magazine holding 15 rounds. Very common equipment amongst Western operators and Monolith stalkers. Will also fit into the FNX-45 handgun.
Standard .45 ACP FNX-45 Magazine

Standard-issue FNX-45 Magazine holding 15 rounds. Newer FNX handguns are more common on Mercenaries, although they are uncommon trophies taken by Monolith soldiers. Will also fit into the FNP-45 handgun.
Standard 9x18 Fort-17 Magazine
Standard-issue 17-round magazine for the Fort-12 handgun. Commonly seen in the Zone as the sidearm of backline Ukrainian Military troops or stalkers with backgrounds as police officers.
Modified 9x19 Fort-17 Magazine
Fort-17 magazine modified to accept 9x19 Parabellum rounds.
Standard 9x19 Glock Magazine
Standard Glock magazine holding 17 rounds. A perennial favorite of American police officers and gangsters.
Modified 9x18 Glock Magazine
Glock magazine modified to take the more common 9x18 Makarov round.
Standard 9x19 Gsh-18 Magazine
Standard-issue Gsh-18 Magazine holding 18 rounds. The Gsh-18 is one of the modern sidearms used by Russian military and law enforcement.
Standard 9x19 Browning Hi-Power Magazine
Standard Browning Hi-Power Magazine holding 13 rounds. The Hi-Power is a reliable and affordable sidearm favored by many stalkers.
Modified 9x18 Browning Hi-Power Magazine
Browning Hi-Power magazine modified to accept the 9x18 Makarov round.
Standard 9x19 MP-443 Magazine
Standard-issue 18-round magazine for the MP-443 "Grach". One of the primary sidearms of Russian military and law enforcement units.
Modified 9x18 MP-443 Magazine
Modified MP-443 Magazine made to accept the 9x18 Makarov round.
Standard 9x18 OTs-33 Pernach Magazine
Standard OTs-33 Pernach Magazine holding 27 rounds. The Pernach succeeded the APS as an automatic machine pistol, being superior in almost every way except for style.
Modified 9x19 OTs-33 Pernach Magazine
OTs-33 Pernach magazine modified to load 9x19 Parabellum rounds.
Standard 9x18 PM Magazine
Standard-issue PM magazine holding 8 rounds. The PM is lacking in both stopping power and magazine capacity, its only saving grace being how common it is.
Modified 9x19 PM Magazine
PM Magazine modified to accept 9x19 Parabellum rounds. The larger round provides a scant increase in power.
Standard 9x18 PMM magazine
Standard-issue PMM magazine holding 12 rounds. A noticeable improvement over the PM.
Modified 9x19 PMM Magazine
PMM Magazine modified to accept 9x19 Parabellum rounds.
Standard 9x19 PP-2000 Magazine
Standard issue PP-2000 Magazine with a capacity of 30 rounds.
Modified 9x18 PP-2000 Magazine
PP-2000 Magazine modified to take the 9x18 Makarov round.
Standard .45 ACP SIG Sauer P220 Magazine
7-round .45 ACP magazine for the SIG P220 handgun. The P220 is popular with bodyguards and security officers, and does a decent job in the Zone.
Standard 7.62x25 TT-33 Magazine
8-round 7.62x25 TT-33 Magazine. This Great War classic still has its admirers in the Zone.
Standard .45 ACP USP Magazine
Standard 12-round USP magazine for .45 ACP variant of the USP.
Standard 9x19 USP Magazine
Standard 15-round USP magazine for the 9mm "Match" variants of the USP.
Standard 9x19 Walther P99 Magazine
16-round standard issue Walther P99 Magazine for 9x19 Parabellum.
Standard 9x18 PP-19 Magazine
Standard 64-round helical magazine for the PP-19 Bizon submachine gun. The high capacity is offset by its inherent unreliability in feeding rounds.
Modified 9x19 PP-19 Magazine
Modified PP-19 magazine made to accept the 9x19 Parabellum round. Clearly the work of a wizard, considering the complexity of the Bizon's helical magazine.
Modified 7.62x25 PP-19 Magazine
Modified PP-19 magazine made to accept the 7.62x25 Tokarev round. Clearly the work of a wizard, considering the complexity of the Bizon's helical magazine.
Standard 9x18 Kiparis Magazine
Standard 30-round Kiparis Magazine. The Kiparis is a cheap submachine gun that has its admirers amongst bandit and renegade clans.
Modified 9x19 Kiparis Magazine
Modified 30-round Kiparis Magazine made to accept the 9x19 Parabellum round. The Kiparis is a cheap submachine gun that has its admirers amongst bandit and renegade clans.
Standard 9x19 Vityaz-SN Magazine
Standard-issue 30-round 9x19 magazine for the Vityaz-SN. Uncommon weapon in the Zone, as the Ukrainian Military doesn't field this weapon.
Modified 9x18 Vityaz-SN Magazine
Vityaz-SN Magazine modified to accept 9x18 Makarov.
Standard 9x19 vz.61 Magazine
20-round standard issue Vz.61 magazine. A reliable weapon that enjoys immense popularity with the criminal underworld.
Modified 9x18 vz.61 Magazine
20-round Vz.61 magazine modified slightly to feed 9x18 Makarov rounds.
Standard 5.7x28 P90 Magazine
Standard 50-round helical magazine used in the P90. So futuristic!
Standard PPSh41 Drum calibre 7.62x25
Standard PPSh41 Drum calibre 7.62x25.
Standard 9x19 MP5 Magazine
30-round magazine for the popular and ubiquitous MP5. The MP5 is a favorite of stalkers from all walks of life, providing sufficient firepower to fend off dogs and bandits alike.
Modified 9x18 MP5 Magazine
MP5 magazine modified to take 9x18 Makarov rounds. Conversions to 9x18 are fairly common for the MP5, given its popularity and familiarity to many of the Zone's technicians.
Modified 9x19 MP7 Magazine

40-round extended MP7 magazine modified to accept 9x19 Parabellum rounds. Due to the somewhat rare nature of 4.6x30 rounds, some thrifty technicians were able to retrofit the MP7 to fire more common 9mm pistol rounds.
Modified 9x18 MP7 Magazine

40-round extended MP7 magazine modified yet again to accept 9x18 Parabellum rounds. The nonstandard modification on top of a nonstandard modification tends to cause issues with reliability with the weapon.
.45 ACP "Frasier" MP5 Magazine
Custom-built magazine for the MP5 "Frasier". Holds 30 rounds of .45 ACP ammunition. Rumored to be a commission for an unknown eccentric Dutyer.
Standard .45 ACP UMP Magazine
Standard 25-round UMP magazine chambered in .45 ACP. The UMP is an uncommon but highly sought after weapon in the Zone due to its excellent handling and high stopping power.
